P.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
P.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Q.title: Will the Republican primary in 2024 be contested by more than three candidates?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, more than three candidates are actively contesting the Republican primary, as determined by their participation in at least one official Republican primary debate or state primary election. Candidates must be recognized by major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) as legitimate contenders. If a candidate withdraws from the race but was previously counted, they will not affect the count of active candidates. The resolution will be based on the final list of candidates as reported by reputable news sources on or after the last primary election date.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

P_and_Q.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and will the Republican primary in 2024 be contested by more than three candidates?
P_and_Q.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. (b) By December 31, 2024, more than three candidates are actively contesting the Republican primary, as determined by their participation in at least one official Republican primary debate or state primary election, and recognized by major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) as legitimate contenders. The resolution will be based on the final list of candidates as reported by reputable news sources on or after the last primary election date.

Candidates who withdraw from the race but were previously counted do not affect the count of active candidates. The resolution will be based on the final list of candidates as reported by reputable news sources on or after the last primary election date.

Q.title: Will Ivanka Trump seek a political office by 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ivanka Trump has officially announced her candidacy for any political office in the United States, which includes but is not limited to local, state, or federal positions. The announcement must be made through a reputable source such as a press release, social media statement from her official accounts, or coverage from major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Any exploratory committees or informal statements will not count as a declaration of intent to seek office. The resolution will also consider any confirmed candidacy for the 2024 election cycle, regardless of the office level.

Q.title: Will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election. An official declaration must be made through a public statement or announcement, and it must be reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If Trump is listed as a candidate on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election, this will also count as a Yes, regardless of his prior announcements. Any informal statements or speculation about running do not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals being the nominee:
- Donald Trump
- Donald Trump Jr.
- Eric Trump
- Ivanka Trump
- Tiffany Trump
- Melania Trump
- Barron Trump

(b) Donald Trump runs for President again in 2024. This condition is satisfied if, by December 31, 2024, Donald Trump has officially declared his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election through a public statement or announcement that is reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). Alternatively, if Donald Trump is listed as a candidate on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election, this will also count as a Yes, regardless of prior announcements. Informal statements or speculation do not count towards this resolution.

The question will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are not met.

P.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q.title: Will there be a major scandal that affects Tucker Carlson's chances of being the Republican nominee before 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, a major scandal involving Tucker Carlson is reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that significantly impacts his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination. A 'major scandal' is defined as any incident that leads to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures. The scandal must be of such magnitude that it is likely to affect his chances of being nominated, as assessed by political analysts or major media outlets.

metadata.source_question: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) There will be a major scandal affecting Tucker Carlson's chances before 2024?
P_and_Q.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Before January 1, 2024, a major scandal involving Tucker Carlson is reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that significantly impacts his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination. The scandal must lead to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures, and is assessed by political analysts or major media outlets as likely to affect his chances of being nominated.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

(b) Before January 1, 2024, a major scandal involving Tucker Carlson is reported by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) that significantly impacts his public image and political viability as a candidate for the Republican nomination. The scandal must lead to widespread media coverage, public backlash, or significant political consequences, such as loss of endorsements or support from key Republican figures, and be likely to affect his chances of being nominated, as assessed by political analysts or major media outlets.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q.title: Will Donald Trump face legal challenges that impact his candidacy before the 2024 election?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces any legal challenges that significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election. Significant impact is defined as any legal action that results in: 1) a formal indictment, 2) a conviction, or 3) a court ruling that restricts his ability to run for or hold office, or 4) a legal settlement that imposes conditions affecting his candidacy. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to confirm the nature and impact of the challenges.

2. Before November 5, 2024, Donald Trump faces any legal challenges that significantly impact his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election. Significant impact is defined as any legal action that results in: (a) a formal indictment, (b) a conviction, (c) a court ruling that restricts his ability to run for or hold office, or (d) a legal settlement that imposes conditions affecting his candidacy. The legal challenges must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) to confirm the nature and impact of the challenges.

The question resolves as **No** if either condition is not met.

Q.title: Will Tucker Carlson receive the endorsement of any major Republican figures by 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Tucker Carlson receives an official endorsement from any major Republican figure. A "major Republican figure" is defined as any current or former elected official at the federal, state, or local level, or any prominent Republican party leader, including but not limited to members of Congress, governors, or party chairs. The endorsement must be publicly announced through a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or through an official statement from the endorsing figure. In the absence of such an announcement, social media endorsements will not count unless they are accompanied by a formal statement or press release. The question will resolve as No if no such endorsement occurs by the deadline.

Q.title: Will Ron DeSantis gain more support than Tucker Carlson among Republican voters by 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ron DeSantis has a higher percentage of support among Republican voters than Tucker Carlson in a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. If multiple polls are conducted, the most recent poll before the resolution date will be used. Support is defined as the percentage of respondents who indicate a preference for DeSantis over Carlson when asked about their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for President. Polls that do not specifically ask about DeSantis and Carlson will not count. In the event of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) By December 31, 2024, Ron DeSantis has a higher percentage of support among Republican voters than Tucker Carlson in a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. Support is defined as the percentage of respondents who indicate a preference for DeSantis over Carlson when asked about their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for President. In the event of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Ron DeSantis gain more support than Tucker Carlson among Republican voters by 2024?
P_or_Q.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Ron DeSantis has a higher percentage of support among Republican voters than Tucker Carlson by December 31, 2024, as measured by a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. In the event of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

P.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Q.title: Will Ron DeSantis gain more support than Tucker Carlson among Republican voters by 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Ron DeSantis has a higher percentage of support among Republican voters than Tucker Carlson in a reputable national poll conducted by a recognized polling organization (e.g., Gallup, Pew Research, Ipsos, YouGov). The poll must include at least 1,000 respondents and be conducted within the last month of 2024. If multiple polls are conducted, the most recent poll before the resolution date will be used. Support is defined as the percentage of respondents who indicate a preference for DeSantis over Carlson when asked about their preferred candidate for the Republican nomination for President. Polls that do not specifically ask about DeSantis and Carlson will not count. In the event of a tie, the question will resolve as No.

Q.title: Will Tucker Carlson run for a different political office before 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, Tucker Carlson officially announces his candidacy for any political office in the United States, including but not limited to local, state, or federal positions. The announcement must be made through a credible public statement, press release, or verified news report from a reputable source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). If he declares his intention to run for multiple offices, the question will still resolve as Yes. Any exploratory committees or potential candidacies that do not result in an official announcement do not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q.title: Will voter turnout among Republican voters increase significantly in the 2024 election compared to 2020?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, voter turnout among Republican voters in the 2024 United States presidential election is reported to be significantly higher than in the 2020 election. 'Significantly higher' is defined as an increase of at least 5 percentage points in the voter turnout rate among registered Republican voters, as reported by reputable sources such as the U.S. Census Bureau or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The turnout rates must be based on official certified election results and may be verified through exit polls or voter surveys conducted by recognized research organizations. If the increase is less than 5 percentage points or if turnout data is inconclusive, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Q.title: Will the Trump family endorse a candidate other than a family member for the 2024 election?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any member of the Trump family officially endorses a candidate for the 2024 election who is not a family member (i.e., not Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, or Donald Trump himself). The endorsement must be publicly announced through a credible medium such as a press release, a public event, or a verified social media account. The endorsement must be clear and unambiguous, indicating support for the non-family candidate in the context of the 2024 presidential election. Any informal statements or suggestions will not count towards this resolution. In case of conflicting endorsements, the first official endorsement will be considered.

Only the first official endorsement will be considered in case of conflicting endorsements.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Q.title: Will the Republican Party change its nomination process before the 2024 election?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, the Republican Party officially alters its nomination process for the 2024 presidential election in a way that is publicly documented and confirmed by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This includes any changes to the rules regarding delegate allocation, primary scheduling, or the overall structure of the nomination process. Any proposed changes must be finalized and publicly announced by the RNC, and credible reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) must corroborate the changes. Temporary or minor adjustments that do not significantly affect the nomination process will not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party changes its nomination process before the 2024 election?
P_and_Q.body:
(a) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. The decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) The Republican Party will have changed its nomination process if, before January 1, 2024, it officially alters its nomination process for the 2024 presidential election in a publicly documented and confirmed manner by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This includes changes to rules regarding delegate allocation, primary scheduling, or the overall structure of the nomination process, provided these are finalized and publicly announced by the RNC and corroborated by credible reports from at least two major news organizations.

(b) Before January 1, 2024, the Republican Party officially alters its nomination process for the 2024 presidential election in a way that is publicly documented and confirmed by the Republican National Committee (RNC). This includes changes to the rules regarding delegate allocation, primary scheduling, or the overall structure of the nomination process, and must be corroborated by credible reports from at least two major news organizations. Temporary or minor adjustments that do not significantly affect the process will not count.

Q.title: Will Donald Trump win the general election if he is the Republican nominee in 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump wins the general election for President of the United States on November 5, 2024, while being the Republican nominee. The outcome must be determined by the official results certified by the relevant election authorities. Any allegations or disputes regarding the election results must be resolved in favor of the official count. If Donald Trump is not the Republican nominee at the time of the election, the question will resolve as No.
